entry.title: Eclipse With Pydev Not Satisfactory
entry.content:
Pydev test, fairly good, but not perfect

I am trying out the pydev plugin for eclipse, so far the code completion looks ok, but the python console is not reliable at all. Here is a very simple test:

Double click to toggle code 
#!/usr/bin/python3

from subprocess import Popen
from subprocess import PIPE
shell_cmd = ["xsel", "-b"]
p = Popen(shell_cmd, stdin=PIPE)
p.communicate("what the hell is this?".encode("ascii"))

This code is just trying to put some text into the system clipboard, and it runs ok in ipython3, yet results are weird in eclipse. The same occurs to pycharm, I have no clue why this is happening.

In the end I find kdevelop with the kdev-python plugin very nice to play with, responsive, snappy, and comes with a konsole terminal on the bottom panel, so that you can paste code directly into an ipython session. Compared to this, eclipse is really just a piece of junk…

entry.title: 'Test With Title 14'
entry.content: Octopress is a framework designed for Jekyll, the static blogging engine powering Github Pages. Have a look through the documentation and if you have trouble, Iâ€™ll be happy to help. If you find errors in the documentation post an issue or fork and send a pull request to the master branch.

entry.title: 'Test With Title 13'
entry.content:
#!/usr/bin/python3

import subprocess
import sys
import os
import time

titlestring = sys.argv[1]
rake_arg = "new_post['{}']".format(titlestring)
p = subprocess.Popen(["rake", rake_arg], stdout=subprocess.PIPE)
out, err = p.communicate()
time.sleep(2)
out = out.decode().strip()
out = out.replace("Creating new post: ", "", 1)
cwd = os.getcwd()
postfile = os.path.join(cwd, out)
print(postfile)

if not err:
    subprocess.call(["gvim", postfile])
else:
    print(err)
    exit(1)
